channel.title: The wandering ballad singer
channel.description:
Folk music series hosted by musician Barre Toelken, who collects folk songs and has worked as a dance band musician, a Forest Service employee, and prospector.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: English ballads I
item.description: In this program, Barre Toelken explores the history of English ballads.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Tragic hero in balladry
item.description: This program explores the motif of the tragic hero in balladry.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Mormon songs
item.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for the Mormon community.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Songs of loggers and miners
item.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for miners and loggers.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Love songs
item.description: In this program, Barre Tolken analyzes and performs various love songs from the folk idiom.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: English ballads II
item.description: In this program, Barre Toelken continues to explore the history of English ballads.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: English ballads, American versions
item.description: This program explores American versions of Engilsh ballads.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Around the world
item.description: This program includes more ballads collected from various parts of the world.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Blues
item.description: In this program, Barre Toelken analyzes and performs several blues songs.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: U.S. History (1900-present)

item.title: Tough men
item.description: This program explores folk songs around the theme of "Tough Men."
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: English ballads IV
item.description: In this program, "English Ballads IV," Barre Toelken plays a variety of infidelity-themed ballads.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Songs of the settlers
item.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for American settlers.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Riddle ballads
item.description: This program explores ballads that include riddles and symbolism.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Early American folk songs
item.description: This program explores early American folk songs.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Sea songs
item.description: In this program, Barre Toelken analyzes and performes several sea songs.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: More wide world singers
item.description: In this program, Barre Toelken continues to explore and perform various ballads from around the world
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Songs of the cowboys
item.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for the cowboys of the American west.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Railroad songs and ballads
item.description: In this program, Barre Toelken analyzes and performs various railroad songs and ballads.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: Railroads--Songs and music

item.title: Bums and vagrants
item.description: This program takes a look at some of the folk music created by and for homeless and itinerant people.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Nonsense songs
item.description: In this program, Barre Toelken focuses on "Nonsense Songs," folk songs with silly, nonsensical lyrics.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor

item.title: Chain gang and work songs
item.description: In this program, Barre Toelken analyzes and performs various chain gang and work songs.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: Work songs

item.title: Wide world singers
item.description: In this program, Barre Toelken explores and perform various ballads from around the world
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: English ballads III
item.description: In this program, "English Ballads III," Barre Toelken plays a variety of death-themed ballads.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Ballads in transition
item.description: This program explores the ways that ballads changed as they made their way to different places.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Odds and ends
item.description: In this program, "Odds and Ends," Barre Toelken analyzes and performs various folk songs and ballads that don't fit the themes of other programs in the series.
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region VI: The West

item.title: Bad women
item.description: This program explores folk songs around the theme of "Bad Women."
item.dc:creator: Toelken, Barre, 1935-
item.dc:subject: Women
